metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
Job Overview
EMEA Total Rewards Analyst is responsible for developing, analyzing, and maintaining Hitachi Vantara’s compensation and benefits offering across 20+ countries. The job incumbent will be a part of Global Total Rewards team that operates in EMEA, APAC and Americas and will be reporting to EMEA Total Rewards Director. The role involves handling a large amount of internal and external data and ability to translate unstructured information into meaningful business decisions. This position requires daily contact with broader HR team as well as with Finance, Legal and management including executives. 

 
Duties & Responsibilities

•	Analyze internal and external compensation data to enable business decisions
•	Develop and maintain EMEA compensation ranges
•	Calculate semi-annual corporate bonus
•	Support compensation review (merit) process
•	Support long term incentive nominations and payments
•	Participate in short term incentive plans design
•	Facilitate compensation decisions by providing feedback to HR Business Partners and management
•	Perform numerous ad hoc analysis as required
•	Submit salary surveys as required
•	Configure in-house and external HRIS systems supporting compensation management
•	Work closely with HRIS on job inventory and WorkDay compensation set up
•	Provide benefits benchmarking and EMEA benefits maintenance

Primary Qualifications

-	3-5 years of experience in multi-country total rewards operations, preferably in technology sector
-	Mercer experience preferable
-	WorkDay experience preferable
-	MarketPay experience imperative
-	Bachelor’s degree 
-	Proven analytical and problem solving abilities.

title: EMEA Compensation & Benefits Analyst
content:
We’re Hitachi Vantara, a global infrastructure business. Our people are the force of meaningful progress. We enable the incredible with data – from taking theme park fans on magical rides, conserving natural resources, protecting rainforests to saving lives. We empower businesses to automate, optimize and advance innovation. Together, we create a sustainable future for all. 
Imagine the sheer breadth of talent it takes to inspire he future. We don’t expect you to ‘fit’ every requirement – your life experience, character, perspective, and passion for achieving great things in the world are equally important to us.Meet our Team 
We are the EMEA Total Rewards team of Hitachi Vantara, part of Global Total Rewards that operates in EMEA, APAC and Americas, responsible for a holistic framework of financial and non-financial rewards that reflects our strategy to attract, motivate, and retain employees. Our team is responsible for building and maintaining best in class compensation and benefits offering for our employees across the region, working with dedicated vendors and ensuring our programs are market competitive and based on best class market practices.                        
What you’ll be doing
You will be a part of Global Total Rewards team that operates in EMEA, APAC and Americas and will be reporting to EMEA Total Rewards Director. You will support development of Hitachi Vantara’s compensation and benefits agenda across 20+ countries in the region.  
You will provide technical and analytical support as well as subject matter advice to the business managers and HR. Your job will also require analyzing and manipulating complex datasets and ability to translate unstructured information into meaningful business decisions. This position requires daily contact with broader HR team as well as with Finance, Legal and management including executives.
The successful candidate in this role should enjoy highly analytical work and problem solving in a dynamic environment, with the ability to own and prioritize multiple assignments and changing priorities.

Support design and delivery of Total Rewards programs,
Contribute to continuous improvement of benefits processes and policies for EMEA to ensure compliance with regional regulations; conducts research & data modelling, identifies trends, and produces recommendations to support new initiatives or enhancements to existing plans with the focus on the UK,
Coordinate global, cyclical compensation activities such as year-end and mid-year comp processes,
Manage the pay benchmarking activities, maintain EMEA compensation ranges, and job evaluation to ensure our ranges are competitive in the markets we operate in, and help attract and retain our talent,
Partner with Brokers and internal stakeholders to provide support in delivery of EMEA benefits (healthcare, welfare, retirement, and flexible benefits),
Manage cyclical reporting i.e. annual Gender Pay Reporting, Annual Pension analysis, participation in salary and benefits surveys,
Resolve escalated queries from Shared Services relating to Total Rewards programs and policies, ensure that all reward processes are documented,
Analyze internal and external compensation and benefits trends and data to enable business decisions,
Support company’s incentive plan process for EMEA countries as well as the ongoing development and transformation of Total Rewards systems and tools,
Participate in and lead on various regional/ global projects to deliver Total Reward agenda e.g., developing reward structure, managing the job matching process, working with external vendors on market data projects,
Provide support and advice to the wider HR community.

What you bring to the team

Bachelor’s degree in business/relevant disciplines, combined with 5+ years of international experience in Total Rewards, preferably in technology sector,
Result oriented and collaborative approach with demonstrated ability to proactively identify and manage complex problems in the job area; strong problems solving skills,
Strong project management/planning skills with the ability to multitask effectively and prioritize workload,
Strong analytical skills including excel modelling, advanced MS office and attention to details,
Excellent communication skills with the ability to work successfully both as a part of the team and independently on own initiative,
Understanding and awareness of compensation and benefits trends in the region and globally,
Understanding and experience with developed HRIS - preferably Workday, working knowledge of Total Rewards systems and tools: Payscale MarketPay, WorkDay, Dartican, job evaluation methodologies. 

#LI-Remote-MM1Championing diversity, equity, and inclusion 
Diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) are integral to our culture and identity. Diverse thinking, a commitment to allyship, and a culture of empowerment help us achieve powerful results. We want you to be you, with all the ideas, lived experience, and fresh perspective that brings. We support your uniqueness and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our team.
How we look after you
We want to help you take care of your today and tomorrow – at home and at work. Which is why we offer industry-leading benefits that go far beyond compensation. That means support, services, and resources that also take care of your holistic health and wellbeing. We’re always looking for new ways of working that bring out our best, which leads to unexpected ideas. Here, you’ll experience a sense of belonging, and discover autonomy, freedom, and ownership as you work alongside talented people you enjoy sharing knowledge with. We’re also champions of life balance and offer flexible arrangements that work for you (role and location dependent).
About us
We’re a global team of innovators. Together, we harness engineering excellence and passion for insight to co-create meaningful solutions to complex challenges. We turn organizations into data-driven leaders that can a make positive impact on their industries and society. If you believe that innovation can inspire the future, this is the place to fulfil your purpose and achieve your potential.
We’re proud to say we’re an equal opportunity employer and welcome all applicants for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, age, disability status or any other protected characteristic. Should you need reasonable accommodations during the recruitment process, please let us know so that we can do our best to set you up for success.
